title: In the Quiet of His Grace
content:
In the quiet of the morning light,
Before the world begins its race,
I sit and breathe, my soul takes flight,
Wrapped in the warmth of endless grace.

The coffee brews, the sparrows sing,
My Bible open, heart at rest,
No crown, no gold, no earthly king,
Can match the peace when I’m His guest.

Each line I write, each verse I pen,
Is not just ink, but prayer and praise,
A whisper through my humble den,
To light another soul’s dark days.

So here I am, with pen in hand,
A servant of the Prince of Peace,
Creating words at His command,
Until my final breath shall cease.
